com.hazelcast.internal.util.concurrent

Interface Pipe<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - type of items in the pipe.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    QueuedPipe<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ManyToOneConcurrentArrayQueue, OneToOneConcurrentArrayQueue

    public interface Pipe<E>
    A container of items processed in sequence. The point of this interface to be a mix-in to the API of JDK's standard Queue adding methods that make sense for a queue which is concurrent, bounded, and supports draining in batches.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long addedCount()
      Returns the number of items added to this pipe since creation.
      int capacity()
      Returns the number of items this pipe can hold at a time.
      int drain(Predicate<? super E> itemHandler)
      Drains the items available in the pipe to the supplied item handler.
      int drainTo(Collection<? super E> target, int limit)
      Drains at most limit available items into the provided Collection.
      int remainingCapacity()
      Returns the number of items this pipe has still room for.
      long removedCount()
      Returns the number of items removed from this pipe since creation.

    • Method Detail

      • addedCount

        long addedCount()
        Returns the number of items added to this pipe since creation.

      • removedCount

        long removedCount()
        Returns the number of items removed from this pipe since creation.

      • capacity

        int capacity()
        Returns the number of items this pipe can hold at a time.

      • remainingCapacity

        int remainingCapacity()
        Returns the number of items this pipe has still room for.

      • drain

        int drain(Predicate<? super E> itemHandler)
        Drains the items available in the pipe to the supplied item handler. The handler returns a boolean which decides whether to continue draining. If it returns false, this method refrains from draining further items and returns.

        Implementation note: this method is expected to take advantage of the fact that many items are being drained at once and minimize the per-item cost of housekeeping.

        Parameters:
        itemHandler - the item handler
        Returns:
        the number of drained items

      • drainTo

        int drainTo(Collection<? super E> target,
            int limit)
        Drains at most limit available items into the provided Collection.

        Implementation note: this method is expected to take advantage of the fact that many items are being drained at once and minimize the per-item cost of housekeeping.

        Parameters:
        target - destination for the drained items
        limit - the maximum number of items to drain
        Returns:
        the number of drained items
